sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"错误"或"缺点"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: error, fault, blunder, flaw, mistake, shortcoming, defect, slip
means: error ： 指思想或行动背离正题轨道或没有得到正确指引而出现的偏差或错误。
fault ： 一般指小并且可宽容的缺点、错误。
blunder ： 通常指由于无知或情况不明造成判断或行动上的大错。
flaw ： 指结构或组织上的缺点，如破裂之处。用作比喻意义时，指品格上的缺陷。
mistake ： 最普通用词，泛指思想上、行为上或认识上的判断或理解方面的错误。
shortcoming ： 指没有达到所要求的标准、没有充分发展或没尽到职责的不足、缺点或短处。多用复数形式。
defect ： 普通用词。指表面上的缺陷，或指人或物本质上的缺点。
slip ： 指因疏忽或无意而造成的差错。

word_mean: 岩体在构造应力作用下发生破裂，沿破裂面两侧的岩体发生显著的位移或失去连续性和完整性而形成的一种构造形迹。
设备或系统在使用中出现不能符合规定性能或丧失执行预定功能的偶然事故状态。
不能执行所要求功能的一种状态。但故障不包括由于预防性维护、外部资源短缺或预先计划的工作中断。

sentence.Network_en: The aircraft made an unscheduled landing after developing an electrical fault.
sentence.Network_cn: 飞机由于发生电力故障而作了临时降落。

sentence.Network_en: He could never accept that he had been at fault.
sentence.Network_cn: 他怎么也无法承认是他的错。

sentence.Network_en: I was disappointed whenever the cook found fault with my work.
sentence.Network_cn: 每当厨师挑剔我干的活儿时，我都非常沮丧。

list.abs: 通讯专业词汇库 - MBA智库文档 ... fault detection 故障检测 fault diagnosis 故障诊断 fault diagnosis time 故障诊断时间.

2008-10-18 -- 工业控制英语词汇大全 ... earth connector 接地线、接地 earth fault 接地故障 earth lead 接地线、接地.
用断层线（fault lines）来比喻金融危机的来源。在地质学上，断层线是指地球表面断裂的地方，地壳板块在这里接触或者冲撞。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of someone who displays a particular commendable quality to an extent) verging on excess
jx.jx_cn_mean: （过分表现出某好品质的人）过分，过度

lj.lj_ly: you're kind, caring and generous to a fault.
lj.lj_ls: 你宽厚、体贴、大方得过分了。

jx.jx_en_mean: To seek, find, and complain about faults; criticize
jx.jx_cn_mean: 挑错，找错：寻找、发现和抱怨错处；批评

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English faut(e) 'lack, failing', from Old French, based on Latin fallere 'deceive'. The -l- was added (in French and English) in the 15th cent. to conform with the Latin word, but did not become standard in English until the 17th cent., remaining silent in pronunciation until well into the 18th

encyclopedia.content: 语法标注解释fault 英音：[fɔ:lt] 美音：[fɔlt]词典解释 名词n. 1. 缺点，毛病，缺陷[C] Every man has his faults. 人无完人，金无足赤。 2. 错误[C] The teacher found many faultsin spelling and grammar in my composition. 老师在我作文中发现许多拼写和语法错误。 3.锛埞У娘級责任，咎[U] The faults is entirely mine. 责任全在于我。 It's no faultof hers. 这不是她的过错。 4. 【地】断层[C] 5.

entry.def: If a bad or undesirable situation is your fault, you caused it or are responsible for it.

example.ex: There was no escaping the fact: it was all his fault...
example.tran: 这全是他的错，这是无法回避的事实。

example.ex: A few borrowers will find themselves in trouble with their repayments through no fault of their own.
example.tran: 一些借款人会发现，他们还款遇到了麻烦，但根本不是由于自身的过失造成的。

entry.def: A fault is a mistake in what someone is doing or in what they have done.

example.ex: It is a big fault to think that you can learn how to manage people in business school.
example.tran: 以为在商学院能学会如何管理人是一大错误。

entry.def: A fault in someone or something is a weakness in them or something that is not perfect.

example.ex: His manners had always made her blind to his faults.
example.tran: 他的彬彬有礼总是使她对他的缺点视而不见。

example.ex: ...a short delay due to a minor technical fault...
example.tran: 一个技术上的小故障引起的短暂延误

entry.def: If you cannot fault someone, you cannot find any reason for criticizing them or the things that they are doing.

example.ex: You can't fault them for lack of invention...
example.tran: 你不能因为他们缺乏创新就指责他们。

example.ex: It is hard to fault the way he runs his own operation.
example.tran: 他经营自己公司的方式无可指摘。

entry.def: A fault is a large crack in the surface of the earth.
A fault in tennis is a service that is wrong according to the rules.
If someone or something is at fault, they are to blame or are responsible for a particular situation that has gone wrong.

example.ex: He could never accept that he had been at fault...
example.tran: 他怎么也无法承认是他的错。

example.ex: There are no indications that standard security arrangements were at fault.
example.tran: 没有迹象表明例行的保安措施存在问题。

entry.def: If you find fault with something or someone, you look for mistakes and complain about them.

example.ex: I was disappointed whenever the cook found fault with my work.
example.tran: 每当厨师挑剔我干的活儿时，我都非常沮丧。

entry.def: If you say that someone has a particular good quality to a fault, you are emphasizing that they have more of this quality than is usual or necessary.

example.ex: Jefferson was generous to a fault...
Others will tell you that she is modest to a fault, funny, clever and warm.
example.tran: 别人会告诉你她有趣、聪明又热情，谦逊得过了头。

means.word_mean: 1. responsibility for a bad situation or event;
2. (geology) a crack in the earth's crust resulting from the displacement of one side with respect to the other;

sentences.sentence: "they built it right over a geological fault"

means.word_mean: 3. the quality of being inadequate or falling short of perfection;

sentences.sentence: "they discussed the merits and demerits of her novel"
"he knew his own faults much better than she did"

means.word_mean: 4. a wrong action attributable to bad judgment or ignorance or inattention;

sentences.sentence: "she was quick to point out my errors"
"I could understand his English in spite of his grammatical faults"

means.word_mean: 5. an imperfection in a device or machine;

sentences.sentence: "if there are any defects you should send it back to the manufacturer"

means.word_mean: 6. (sports) a serve that is illegal (e.g., that lands outside the prescribed area);
7. (electronics) equipment failure attributable to some defect in a circuit (loose connection or insulation failure or short circuit etc.);

sentences.sentence: "it took much longer to find the fault than to fix it"

means.word_mean: 1. put or pin the blame on

auth_sentence.content: This album is polite, almost to a fault.
auth_sentence.res_content: This album is polite, almost to a fault.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This album is polite, almost to a fault.

auth_sentence.content: I also fault the scientific community in this process.
auth_sentence.res_content: I also fault the scientific community in this process.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I also fault the scientific community in this process.

auth_sentence.content: But some say its not entirely China's fault.
auth_sentence.res_content: But some say its not entirely China's fault.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But some say its not entirely China's fault.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =err/deceive,表示"犯错误,欺骗"; 2. = 表示"错,假"

stems_affixes.word_buile: de加强+fault犯错误,欺骗→更加错→一拖再拖的债务

Sentence.sentence: If you tell your dim friend that he has the potential of an Einstein, you're just underlining his faults.
You are trying to make him feel better about his faults
He is always finding fault with Marsha.
If they fail, it's their fault.
They often find fault with it.

means.word_mean: 缺点, 缺陷; 故障

sentences.en: His greatest fault is that he talks too much.
sentences.cn: 他最大的缺点是说得太多。

sentences.en: There is a fault in this machine.
The acrobat deliberately faulted the performance once to make it look difficult.
sentences.cn: 表演者故意把表演做错一次，以显得表演很难。

sentences.en: Her tongue stammered and faulted with rage.
sentences.cn: 她讲话因生气而结结巴巴并出错。

jushi.english: Faults are thick where love is thin.
jushi.chinese: 一朝情义淡,样样不顺眼。

jushi.english: The roof collapsed because of a fault in the beams.
jushi.chinese: 房顶塌了,因为横梁有毛病。

jushi.english: I shall not bear with his fault.
